info.title: Slotify API
info.description: API to communicate and schedule meetings with Microsoft.

get.summary: Subscribe to notifications eventstream.
get.description: Establishes a stream connection to receive real-time updates about rendering tasks via Server-Sent Events (SSE).

200.description: A continuous stream of server-sent events.

Cache-Control.description: No caching is allowed for this stream.

Connection.description: Advises the client to keep the connection open.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of this stream is text/event-stream.

get.summary: Get user's unread notifications.

patch.summary: Mark a notification as being read.

parameters.description: Numeric ID of the user to get

get.summary: Healthcheck route.
Get current user's details.
Search for users with by email and name. MUST provide one of the query params. Returns a max of 10 searches.

parameters.description: Partial email of user to search for

200.description: Users matching the given query parameter.

post.summary: Idempotent route, just returns appropriate time slots along with their respective ratings.
Check if the old meeting can be rescheduled

canBeRescheduled.description: true if there are valid meeting slots for the old meeting to change to

SchedulingSlotsSuccessResponse.description: Scheduling algorithm returns the valid time slots and their respective ratings.

RescheduleRequests.description: All the reschedule requests for the current user

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid

requested_by.description: The user ID of the person who requested the reschedule

status.description: The status of the reschedule request

requested_at.description: The time the request was made

newStartTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

newEndTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

msftMeetingID.description: The microsoft meeting ID of the old meeting

meetingId.description: The meeting ID of the old meeting

meetingDuration.description:
The length of the meeting, denoted in **ISO 8601** format. - Example:
  - **1 hour** ‚Üí `'PT1H'`
  - **2 hours, 30 minutes** ‚Üí `'PT2H30M'`
- `'P'` is the duration designator. - `'T'` separates date and time components. - `'H'` (hours) and `'M'` (minutes) specify the time duration. - If omitted, the default duration is **30 minutes** (`'PT30M'`).

startTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

endTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

ReschedulingCheckBodySchema.description: Request body of the details of the two meetings

meetingDuration.description:
The length of the meeting, denoted in **ISO 8601** format. - Example:
  - **1 hour** ‚Üí `'PT1H'`
  - **2 hours, 30 minutes** ‚Üí `'PT2H30M'`
- `'P'` is the duration designator. - `'T'` separates date and time components. - `'H'` (hours) and `'M'` (minutes) specify the time duration. - If omitted, the default duration is **30 minutes** (`'PT30M'`).

msftMeetingID.description: The microsoft meeting ID of the old meeting if it exists

isOrganizerOptional.description: if organizer does not need to be there, then set true. If the organizer is the only person in the meeting, keep false

ReschedulingRequestBodySchema.description: Request body of the details of the two meetings

meetingDuration.description:
The length of the meeting, denoted in **ISO 8601** format. - Example:
  - **1 hour** ‚Üí `'PT1H'`
  - **2 hours, 30 minutes** ‚Üí `'PT2H30M'`
- `'P'` is the duration designator. - `'T'` separates date and time components. - `'H'` (hours) and `'M'` (minutes) specify the time duration. - If omitted, the default duration is **30 minutes** (`'PT30M'`).

attendees.description: Array of all the attendees user id

startTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

endTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

startRangeTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

endRangeTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format In the format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ Where lowercase letters are replaced by their numerical values

msftMeetingID.description: The microsoft meeting ID of the old meeting

meetingStartTime.description: The start of the meeting denoted in *ISO 8601* format

ReschedulingRequestSingleBodySchema.description: Request body of the details of the old meeting

msftMeetingID.description: The microsoft meeting ID of the old meeting

meetingName.description: custom field, this is used for the AI model

meetingDuration.description:
The length of the meeting, denoted in **ISO 8601** format. - Example:
  - **1 hour** ‚Üí `'PT1H'`
  - **2 hours, 30 minutes** ‚Üí `'PT2H30M'`
- `'P'` is the duration designator. - `'T'` separates date and time components. - `'H'` (hours) and `'M'` (minutes) specify the time duration. - If omitted, the default duration is **30 minutes** (`'PT30M'`).

countryOrRegion.description: The country or region. It's a free-format string value, for example, "United States".

EmailAddress.description: directly maps to MSFT Email Address, see info here:[MSFT EmailAddress Struct Docs](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/graph/api/resources/emailaddress?view=graph-rest-1.0)

InvitesGroup.description: References a Slotify Invite For a Group
